title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 125.7 - Teacher-pupil ratio
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 125.7 - Teacher-pupil ratio

State Regulations
(a) Supervision. In a school there shall be more than one adult available to any
group at all times. (b) Class size. There shall be an enrollment of not less than six pupils in a group in any one
session of either nursery school or kindergarten. (c) Staffing. (1)

Nursery school. (i) There shall be no more than 20 children
in one group in one room. (ii)

For
three-year-olds, the ratio of children to adults shall not be greater than 8:1, with a qualified teacher in attendance at all times. (iii)

For four-year-olds, the ratio of
children to adults shall not be greater than 10:1, with a qualified teacher in
attendance at all times. (2)

Kindergarten. (i) There shall be no more than 22 children
in one group in one room. (ii)

For
five-year-olds, the ratio of children to teachers shall not be more than 15:1, with a qualified teacher in attendance at all times. (3)

Day care center. If a school is in
session more than six hours a day, the rules and regulations of the Department
of Social Services regarding ratio of children to child care staff shall be
followed (18 NYCRR
451.8
). Notes
